DOC.brief_summary: The propose study randomize trial evaluate impact 12-week LIVESTRONG exercise program vs. waitlist control cancer-related outcome 200 cancer survivor .
DOC.brief_title: Effect LIVESTRONG YMCA Exercise Program Cancer Related Outcomes Cancer Survivors
DOC.detailed_description: The propose study randomize trial evaluate impact 12-week LIVESTRONG exercise program vs. waitlist control cancer-related outcome 200 cancer survivor . Participants undergo baseline test Dana-Farber Yale , include administration questionnaire assess quality life presence cancer treatment-related symptom , fast blood draw , evaluation body composition ( use dual energy X-ray absorptiometry ( DEXA ) . Participants take part 12-week LIVESTRONG Program assign wait-list control group . All measurement repeat Dana-Farber Yale 12-week exercise program control period .
DOC.criteria: Cancer diagnosis exclude nonmelanoma skin cancer Physically able exercise Able complete form understand instruction English Agrees randomly assign either exercise waitlist control group Willing able attend one LIVESTRONG YMCA program 12 week Willing able complete baseline 3month clinic visit > 80 year age < 18 year age Recent ( past 6 month ) stroke/myocardial infarction congestive heart failure/documented ejection fraction < 40 % Plans undergo major surgical procedure next 6 month Presence dementia major psychiatric disease would preclude participation groupbased exercise program Pregnant woman woman intend become pregnant
